parameters.description: Response field. The fields are separated with commas. Embedded fields are separated with dots. To exclude a field, use “-” in front of its name. In case the parameter is not defined, the method returns all fields. Maximum limit: 100.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description:
Search type. Default is "startswith". Valid values:

  • "startswith" — Search by initial characters of player name. Minimum length: 3 characters. Maximum length: 24 characters. (by default)
  • "exact" — Search by exact match of player name. Case insensitive. You can enter several names, separated with commas (up to 100).
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Player name search string. Parameter "type" defines minimum length and type of search. Using the exact search type, you can enter several names, separated with commas. Maximum length: 24.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Number of returned entries (fewer can be returned, but not more than 100). If the limit sent exceeds 100, a limit of None is applied (by default).
parameters.name: limit

fields.description:

  • 0 — None
  • 1 — 3rd Class
  • 2 — 2nd Class
  • 3 — 1st Class
  • 4 — Ace Tanker
name: mark_of_mastery

parameters.description: Message ID

parameters.description: Number of returned entries. If the value sent exceeds 100, a limit of 25 is applied (by default). Default is 25. Min value is 1.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Page number. Default is 1. Min value is 1.
parameters.name: page_no

parameters.description:
Sorting. Valid values:

  • importance — by message importance

  • -importance — by message importance in reverse order

  • created_at — by date of message creation

  • -created_at — by date of message creation in reverse order

  • updated_at — by message update date

  • -updated_at — by message update date in reverse order

  • type — by message type

  • -type — by message type in reverse order. Default is "importance, type". Maximum limit: 100.
parameters.name: order_by

parameters.description: Search for messages with end date of relevance equal or after the value. Date in UNIX timestamp or ISO 8601 format. E.g.: 1376542800 or 2013-08-15T00:00:00
parameters.name: expires_after

parameters.description: Search for messages with end date of relevance before the value. Date in UNIX timestamp or ISO 8601 format. E.g.: 1376542800 or 2013-08-15T00:00:00
parameters.name: expires_before

  • "battle" — Battle messages
parameters.name: type

parameters.description:

  • "standard" — Standard messages

parameters.name: search

parameters.description:
Tournament status. Maximum limit: 100. Valid values:

  • "upcoming" — Tournament is planned
  • "registration_started" — Players can apply to join the tournament
  • "registration_finished" — Registration has finished
  • "running" — The first match has started
  • "finished" — The last match among all stages has been played
  • "complete" — Tournament has been completed
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Result page number. Default is 1. Min value is 1.
parameters.name: page_no

parameters.description: Page limit. Number of tournaments in one page. Default is 10. Min value is 1. Maximum value: 25.
parameters.name: limit

matches.description: Method returns information about matches of a particular tournament and stage.

fields.description: ID of the following match for the loser
name: next_match_for_looser

fields.description: ID of the following match for the winner
name: next_match_for_winner

fields.description:
Match state. Valid values:

  • "waiting_results" — Match is still in progress and there are no final results
  • "got_results" — Match was finished and there are final results
  • "canceled" — Match was cancelled
  • "upcoming" — Already scheduled match state
name: state

matches.name: Tournament matches
